message:
Issuance of First Voucher to Continuing Students (Fall, 2020)

Published On:  Oct 29, 2020

Students are informed that the University has issued first voucher (Semester Enrollment fee + One Course fee) for Fall, 2020 semester to continuing students, who have made course selection from October 22, 2020 to October 29, 2020. 

You are directed to deposit payable voucher as per given schedule.

MS Computer Science (Fall 2020 Semester)

Merit List of Candidates Eligible for Interview Published

https://www.vu.edu.pk/NewsDetails.aspx?type=&NewsId=4348

Course selection is not working for MSCS students.

On 2020-11-05, MS CS department has reported that this error has been referred to the IT department and will get fixed soon.

Extension in due date of Need based Scholarship for Fall, 2020 
Published On:  Friday, November 6, 2020

All the students are informed that last date to apply for need based scholarship (Fall'2020 semester) has been extended till Thursday, November 12, 2020.

https://www.vu.edu.pk/NewsDetails.aspx?type=&NewsId=4350
On 2020-11-06, MSCS department sent out this email to all MSCS students from mscs_courseselection@vu.edu.pk

To find email addresses of other VU students, log in to your VU Gmail account and then visit this link:

https://contacts.google.com/directory

It will take some time to load. Eventually, it will display all the email addresses that are present in the VU organization.

The administrators have kept some addresses hidden probably for privacy and to fight spam.

You can look up other students from your batch, using your VU ID.

Kindly do not use abuse this system. So far, VU has not provided any way for students to communicate with each other. If you misuse it, then administrators can hide the directory, and we will not be able to discover our fellow batch members.

Issuance of 1st Voucher to Continuing Students (Fall-2020 Semester)
Published On:  Monday, November 9, 2020 

Students are informed that the University has issued first voucher (Semester Enrollment fee + One Course fee) for Fall, 2020 semester to continuing students, who have made course selection from October 29, 2020 to November 09, 2020. Furthermore, the University has already issued said fee voucher to those who made course selection prior to October 29, 2020.

You are directed to deposit payable voucher as per given schedule.

Federal Minister for IT om, Syed Ameen Ul Haq visited Virtual University
Published On:  Tuesday, November 10, 2020

‚ö†Ô∏è Attention MSCS 2020 students ‚ö†Ô∏è
The bug in VULMS course selection has been fixed.

Please make your course selection ASAP.
Finalize your course selection by 2020-11-12

CS719-Research Methodologies is not available for selection in the first semester of MSCS.

Official VU response:
You will be able to select it in the second semester.

‚ö†Ô∏è About MSCS course selection ‚ö†Ô∏è
Official VU response:

As per HEC guidelines, 
In first semester, you should choose two required courses and one course from your specialization. 

You can choose courses from any semester but it is better to choose two required courses and one course from your specialization even if these are 2nd or any semester courses.

Board of Governors of Virtual University had a meeting with the President of Pakistan
Published On:  Wednesday, November 11, 2020 

https://www.vu.edu.pk/NewsDetails.aspx?type=&NewsId=4354

President of Pakistan, Dr Arif Alvi tweeted about Virtual University.
He said

Vitual University will lead the way towards a future of non-elitist higher education, available at much lower cost than that available at physical brick & mortar universities. A great opportunity for those who pass FA/FSc, need to earn livelihood, & at same time study for BA/BSc.

Gudielines for MSCS Course Selection
Official VU response

You can select minimum one and maximum three courses in a semester. 

Please see the attached image for the generic semester wise guideline for course selection, as recommended by HEC.

Course Selection due date has been extended up to Wednesday, November 18
Published On:  Thursday, November 12, 2020 

It is hereby intimated that course selection due date for add/drop/replace course(s) has been extended up to Wednesday, November 18, 2020.

Students‚Äô failing to enroll/ select any course(s) by the last date will be treated as ‚ÄúInactive Student‚Äù such students may continue their studies after ‚ÄúReadmission‚Äù as per the University policy.

Note:

1.    Students' will be responsible for his/her late course enrollment, any quizzes or assignment(s) if have been given or taken; 
2.    No request for the enrollment of courses and unfreeze of semester will be entertained after above said date;
3.    Fee voucher once issued will not be adjusted/revised.

CS701 - Theory of Computation 
JFLAP 7.0 Simulator Tutorial for designing Turing Machines 

Please visit following tutorial link for using the JFLAP 7.0 Simulator. 

JFLAP is software for experimenting with formal languages topics including nondeterministic finite automata, Turing machines, and multi-tape Turing machines. 

In addition to constructing and testing examples for these, JFLAP allows one to experiment with construction proofs from one form to another. 

This tutorial will help design the Turing machine in upcoming your assignment task.

http://www.jflap.org/tutorial/

CS701 - Theory of Computation
Weekly Online Interactive Sessions

We will have online interactive sessions every week through Skype on:

Monday from 3:00 PM to 4:00 PM

Topic/Agenda for these sessions will be ‚ÄúTopics discussed in lectures scheduled in the previous week‚Äù. 

Skype id to join the session:        saima.vu1

Please send a request to the above mentioned skype id. Enter your VU ID and name to join the session during the designated time.

Expected date and topics of the first assignment
Offifical Response

Assignment may be uploaded next week, and it will cover all delivered lectures, uptill now.

Steps to run JFLAP

1. Install latest Java
Java8 is not necessary. Get the latest one. I ran the JFLAP from OpenJDK 15
Direct Download: https://t.me/vuopak/50

2. Download the jar file
Direct Download: https://t.me/vuopak/49

3. Double click on the jar file
Or

Open command line and write
java -jar <path to the jar file>

LMS Service Outage
Published On:  Thursday, November 26, 2020 

We regret the recent outage of our LMS service which was impacted due to certain externally generated non-genuine traffic. The ICT teams worked diligently to identify and mitigate the issue in order to normalize our services. 

Inconvenience caused is highly regretted. 

Please check with your respective course instructors for any rescheduling in your semester activities.

https://www.vu.edu.pk/NewsDetails.aspx?type=&NewsId=4361

Mid Term Quiz instead of Mid Term Examinations
Published On:  Wednesday, December 2, 2020 

Due to the prevailing COVID - 19 Pandemic, the Virtual University of Pakistan has decided that an online ‚ÄúMid Term Quiz‚Äù will be conducted in lieu of Mid Term Examinations for the Fall 2020 semester.

Please note the followings:

1. The date sheet schedule for ‚ÄúMid Term Quiz‚Äù will be published after December 16, 2020.
2. ‚ÄúMid Term Quiz‚Äù will be conducted between December 26, 2020, to January 10, 2021.

https://www.vu.edu.pk/NewsDetails.aspx?type=&NewsId=4368

On issues and bugs in the new version of LMS
Published On:  Sunday, December 6, 2020 

Recently, Virtual University of Pakistan launched a new version of LMS with a new user interface and intuitive features. However, some functionality and features have been presented differently for ease of use and student activity tracking. Like any new version of a software some features are liked by users and others take time getting used to. The ICT teams are actively looking into any complaints and evaluating feedback in order to make it even better and more functional.

At the same time, unfortunately, some miscreants started generating severe BruteForce and DDoS cyber-attacks on LMS to make it inaccessible for obvious reasons. The ICT teams are continuously taking measures to mitigate these attacks on our websites and will not rest till the issue is resolved. We regret the inconvenience caused and appreciate your patience.

The University authorities have identified these sources and gathered the requisite information, which is now being sent to FIA Cyber Crimes wing for further action against these culprits.

Furthermore, to compensate students with their graded activities the university extended the deadlines for different graded activities as deemed appropriate, so that students could make their submissions.

https://www.vu.edu.pk/NewsDetails.aspx?type=&NewsId=4369

VU Cisco Network Academy is starting a new batch

VU Cisco Network Academy is starting a new batch of the following courses.

1. Network Essentials
2. Introduction to Internet of Things (IoT)

These are basic courses, but it will open the doors to several highly valuable certifications. This is just the first step to a whole new dimension of IT related courses.

So, don‚Äôt miss the opportunity and get yourself enrolled in the courses and get an internationally recognized certificate.

Please visit https://www.vu.edu.pk/netacad/ for registration.

Registration opening date is 3 December, 2020
Registration closing date is 8 December, 2020

On December 3, 2020, VU clarified that 
in place of Mid Term Exams, it will either conduct a Mid Term Quiz or will issue a Special Assignment.

Postgraduate Students : Submit your Migration Certificate

All students (Except VU graduates) are required to submit their Migration Certificate (original) from the last Pakistani institute/university attended to the office of the Registrar within 6 weeks of issuance of their admission offer letter. 
Submit the same on or before January 11, 2021

Please note the following:

1. Photocopy/color copy/scanned copy of Migration Certificate is unacceptable.
2. (a) Campus based students may submit the said certificate to their respective campus and obtain receipt.
2. (b) Home based/overseas students may send directly to VU Head Office address.
3. VU ID must be clearly mentioned on top right corner of the migration certificate.

Blocking of VU-LMS Accounts
Published On:  Tuesday, December 22, 2020

It is informed that LMS Accounts of all such students who have not paid their outstanding dues shall be blocked on December 24, 2020. Students with blocked Accounts will not be able to appear in Exams and carry out academic activities. It is therefore advised to clear all outstanding dues at the earliest, in order to avoid any inconvenience.

List of Merit Based Scholarship Fall, 2020 ‚Äì Newly Admitted Students
Published On:  Wednesday, December 23, 2020


The Management Committee for Scholarships has finalized the students for Merit Scholarship (Newly Admitted Students) for Fall 2020. 

Only those students are enlisted for scholarship who have obtained highest percentage marks in his/her previous degree. The students who have scored highest percentage marks and his/her name is mentioned in the above list and obtained percentage marks ranged as given in column (B) will be eligible for merit scholarship as mentioned in column (C).

Errors and Omissions Excepted, within two weeks after publication of merit scholarship list. (Queries to be sent; if any at qamar.zaman@vu.edu.pk)
The Students those having percentage marks‚Äô range but not mentioned in list are not eligible for scholarship because only top students those having highest marks are considered for scholarship.
